intro: Diarrhena aquatica, commonly known as water diarrhena, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in regions with high humidity. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, often floating on the water surface. Diarrhena aquatica plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
